questions: The wires for making electric circuits do not normally become hot but a filament of an electric bulb becomes hot. Why?
option1: The wire in electric circuits is made of insulator material.
option2: The wire in electric circuits has an insulator coating.
option3: The wire in electric circuits is made of a very good conductor.
option4: The wire in electric circuits utilizes the heat produced.

questions: How do miniature circuit breakers work?
option1: By having pieces of metal wire that melt when current gets too high
option2: By having a switch that will break a circuit if the current gets too high
option3: By having pieces of metal wire that melt when current gets too low
option4: By having a switch that will break a circuit if the current gets too low

questions: Is using a high current fuse in a low current appliance dangerous?

option1: Fuses are inserted in electric circuits of all buildings.
option2: There is a maximum limit on the current which can safely flow through the electric circuits.
option3: There is a minimum limit on the current which can safely flow through the electric circuits.
option4: If a proper fuse is inserted in a circuit it will blow off if current exceeds the safe limit.

questions: A fuse is used in a laptop and another fuse is used in a refrigerator. Choose the correct statement.
option1: Melting point of a laptop fuse wire > melting point of the refrigerator fuse wire.
option2: Melting point of a laptop fuse wire < melting point of the refrigerator fuse wire.
option3: Melting point of a laptop fuse wire = melting point of the refrigerator fuse wire.
option4: A laptop does not need a fuse at all.
